title: LIBERTy: A Causal Framework for Benchmarking Concept-Based Explanations of LLMs with Structural Counterfactuals
summary: LIBERTy is a novel framework that uses explicitly defined Structured Causal Models (SCMs) and Large Language Models (LLMs) to generate structural counterfactuals, creating robust benchmarks for evaluating concept-based explanations of LLMs. This addresses the limitations of costly and imperfect human-written counterfactuals, providing new datasets (including for disease detection) and a metric for faithful evaluation. The framework reveals substantial headroom for improving current explanation methods and identifies reduced sensitivity to demographic concepts in proprietary LLMs, likely due to post-training mitigation.

title: Sporadic Creutzfeldt Jakob disease presenting with cerebral atrophy following traumatic brain injury mimicking hydrocephalus a case report and literature review
summary: This case report details a patient diagnosed with sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (sCJD) who initially presented with cognitive deficits, gait instability, and incontinence, 8 months after a traumatic brain injury (TBI). The initial CT imaging showed cerebral ventricle dilation, misleadingly mimicking hydrocephalus, until further specialized investigations confirmed sCJD as the underlying cause of cerebral atrophy.

title: Jordan-Segmentable Masks: A Topology-Aware definition for characterizing Binary Image Segmentation
summary: This paper introduces Jordan-segmentable masks, a topology-aware definition for binary image segmentation, designed to overcome the limitations of conventional metrics that fail to capture structural and topological coherence. It leverages digital Jordan theory and homological invariants (Betti numbers) to provide a mathematically rigorous, unsupervised criterion for assessing if a segmentation correctly partitions an image into two topologically separate, connected components, particularly crucial for applications like medical imaging.

title: Representation-Aware Unlearning via Activation Signatures: From Suppression to Knowledge-Signature Erasure
summary: This paper introduces the Knowledge Immunization Framework (KIF), a representation-aware unlearning method for Large Language Models (LLMs) that achieves true knowledge erasure by targeting internal activation signatures, rather than merely suppressing surface outputs. KIF successfully breaks the long-standing stability-erasure tradeoff, demonstrating near-oracle erasure while preserving model utility at oracle levels across various LLM architectures.

title: causalfe: Causal Forests with Fixed Effects in Python
summary: The `causalfe` package provides a Python implementation of Causal Forests with Fixed Effects (CFFE), designed to estimate heterogeneous treatment effects robustly in panel data settings. It addresses the common challenge of spurious heterogeneity caused by unit and time fixed effects in standard causal forest methods by employing node-level residualization during tree construction. The paper details the methodology, software interface, and validates its performance through simulation studies across various data generating processes.

title: Breaking Up with Normatively Monolithic Agency with GRACE: A Reason-Based Neuro-Symbolic Architecture for Safe and Ethical AI Alignment
summary: This paper introduces GRACE (Governor for Reason-Aligned ContainmEnt), a neuro-symbolic, reason-based containment architecture designed to ensure AI agents' decisions are normatively aligned and not just instrumentally effective. GRACE decouples normative reasoning from instrumental decision-making through a three-module system comprising a Moral Module, a Decision-Making Module, and a Guard, enabling interpretability, contestability, and verifiable moral compliance for AI agents of diverse designs. It demonstrates its efficacy using an LLM therapy assistant, showing how stakeholders can understand and refine agent behavior.

title: ErrEval: Error-Aware Evaluation for Question Generation through Explicit Diagnostics
summary: This paper introduces ErrEval, an Error-aware Evaluation framework designed to address critical defects like factual hallucinations and answer mismatches in automatic Question Generation (QG) outputs, which are often overlooked by existing black-box evaluation methods. ErrEval reformulates evaluation as a two-stage process: explicit error diagnosis by a lightweight identifier, followed by informed scoring using LLM evaluators guided by these diagnostic signals. Experiments show ErrEval significantly improves alignment with human judgments and effectively mitigates the overestimation of low-quality generated questions.

title: A Predictive Model for Synergistic Oncolytic Virotherapy: Unveiling the Ping-Pong Mechanism and Optimal Timing of Combined Vesicular Stomatitis and Vaccinia Viruses
summary: A mathematical model reveals a `ping-pong` synergistic mechanism between Vesicular Stomatitis Virus (VSV) and Vaccinia Virus (VV) for oncolytic virotherapy, where VV's B18R protein neutralizes interferon-α, enhancing VSV replication and leading to accelerated tumor clearance. Optimal therapeutic outcomes are achieved through immediate VSV administration followed by a precisely timed delayed VV injection.

title: Handling Missing Modalities in Multimodal Survival Prediction for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
summary: Accurate survival prediction in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) requires the integration of heterogeneous clinical, radiological, and histopathological information. title: Radiomics-Integrated Deep Learning with Hierarchical Loss for Osteosarcoma Histology Classification
summary: This paper introduces two novel approaches to enhance deep learning models for osteosarcoma histology classification: integrating radiomic features as multimodal input and employing a hierarchical loss function for two binary tasks (tumor vs. non-tumor, viable vs. non-viable). These methods collectively address the challenge of poor patient-level generalization observed in prior studies. The proposed techniques significantly improve classification performance on the TCIA OS Tumor Assessment dataset, establishing a new state-of-the-art for automated osteosarcoma viability assessment.

title: Relation Extraction Capabilities of LLMs on Clinical Text: A Bilingual Evaluation for English and Turkish
